source:
## Assignment #1 Data collection and curation

#### Below we are going to analyze covid vaccination data from a survey created in google forms:

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
df = pd.read_csv("covid survey results.csv")
#### First step: Familiarize with data set
Looking at the head and tail of a data set can be helpful to know  what type of date we are analyzing.

text/html:

3 3 f 20 yes moderna yes arm pain
4 4 f 49 yes moderna yes headache, arm pain

source: Another important step is knowing the lenght of the dataset, which can be easily found with the next function.
In the next lines we are checking which types of data we are analyzig, which can be helpful when trying to process and clean it:

source:
### Clean

While looking at the data, I noticied someone added the word "years" in the age entry box, for all the entries to be equal we are going to change that

### Histogram

This next graph presents the distribution of ages in the survey.
For the graph to be made is important to first convert string into interger:

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
df.hist(column= "Age")
plt.ylabel("Number of Observations")
When creating another histogram with the distibution of the different types of vaccines, we noticed moderna vaccine doubles, apparently the user added a space at the end of the word, so lets fix it:

text/plain:
moderna        35
pfizer         30
J&J            19
moderna         1
AstraZeneca     1
Name: if yes, which?, dtype: int64

text/html:
respondent Gender Age Vaccineted? if yes, which? Side effects? which ones: (Select all that apply)
2 2 f 20 yes moderna no none
text/plain:
respondent Gender  Age Vaccineted? if yes, which? Side effects?  \
2           2      f   20        yes        moderna             no   

  which ones: (Select all that apply)  
2                                none

text/html: respondent Gender Age Vaccineted? if yes, which? Side effects? which ones: (Select all that apply)
text/plain:
Empty DataFrame
Columns: [respondent, Gender, Age, Vaccineted?, if yes, which?, Side effects?, which ones: (Select all that apply)]
Index: []

source: Now that the problem is fixed, here is the histogram:

type_counts = df["if yes, which?"].value_counts()
plt.rcParams["figure.figsize"] = (20,10)
type_counts.plot.bar()
plt.xlabel("Covid vaccine type")
plt.ylabel("Number of Observations")
### Now lets compare different vaccines and its effect on people:
